cab.content: v LOF THE PRESIDENT OF THE BOARD OF EDUCATION.1, During last week the Department was engaged mainly in preparing the final draft of the Education Bill which I introduced in the House of Commons on Friday.2. I have appointed a Departmental Committee to inquire into the principles for fixing salaries of teachers in Secondary and Technical Schools and Institutions of Higher Education other than Universities.3. At the request of the Ministry of Munitions and the Food Controller I have issued a Circular inviting the assistance of school children in collecting chestnuts to be used as a substitute for grain in the manufacture of explosives.4, I have received a number of Deputations on various points either arising out of the provisions of the Education Bill or connected with the general administration of the Department.17th August. 1917.
